title: Concept wikification for COVID-19
venue: Proceedings of the 1st Workshop on NLP for COVID-19 (Part 2) at EMNLP 2020.
excerpt: Wikification of COVID-19 texts using large language models trained on scientific papers.
citation: Lymperopoulos, P., Qiu, H., & Min, B. (2020). Concept wikification for COVID-19. Proceedings of the 1st Workshop on NLP for COVID-19 (Part 2) at EMNLP 2020. https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/2020.nlpcovid19-2.29

title: Branching principles of animal and plant networks identified by combining extensive data, machine learning and modelling.
venue: Journal of the Royal Society Interface
excerpt: Modelling the branching of vascular network tissue as asymmetric fractal structures. The model is further investigate in its ability to describe and discriminate between various species.
citation: Brummer, A. B., Lymperopoulos, P., Shen, J., Tekin, E., Bentley, L. P., Buzzard, V., Gray, A., Oliveras, I., Enquist, B. J., & Savage, V. M. (2021). Branching principles of animal and plant networks identified by combining extensive data, machine learning and modelling. Journal of the Royal Society Interface, 18 (174), 20200624.

title: Integrating planning, execution and monitoring in the presence of open world novelties: Case study of an open world monopoly solver.
excerpt: Monopoly-playing agent that operates in an Open world, where game rules, elements and concepts are subject to change at test time. Gopalakrishnan, Sriram, et al. "Integrating Planning, Execution and Monitoring in the presence of Open World Novelties: Case Study of an Open World Monopoly Solver."

title: Forecasting covid-19 counts at a single hospital: A hierarchical bayesian approach.
venue: Poster in ICLR 2021 Workshop on Machine Learning for Preventing and Combating Pandemics
excerpt: A bayesian model for forecasting the daily number of hospitalized COVID-19 patients at a single hospital site.
citation: Lee, A. H., Lymperopoulos, P., Cohen, J. T., Wong, J. B., & Hughes, M. C. (2021). Forecasting covid-19 counts at a single hospital: A hierarchical bayesian approach.Poster in ICLR 2021 Workshop on Machine Learning for Preventing and Combating Pandemics, arXiv preprint arXiv:2104.09327.

title: Deep-learning-based image restoration of depth-resolved, label-free, two-photon images for the quantitative morphological and functional characterization of human cervical tissues.
venue: Imaging, Manipulation, and Analysis of Biomolecules, Cells, and Tissues XIX
excerpt: Using denoising autoencoders to accelerate lable-free medical imaging.
citation: Deep-learning-based image restoration of depth-resolved, label-free, two-photon images for the quantitative morphological and functional characterization of human cervical tissues.Polleys, C. M., Lymperopoulos, P., Thieu, H.-T., Genega, E., Liu, L., & Georgakoudi, I. (2021). Deep-learning-based image restoration of depth-resolved, label-free, two-photon images for the quantitative morphological and functional characterization of human cervical tissues. Imaging, Manipulation, and Analysis of Biomolecules, Cells, and Tissues XIX, 11647, 116470Z.

title: Novelcraft: A dataset for novelty detection and discovery in open worlds.
excerpt: A new Dataset for novelty detection in open worlds based on Minecraft.
citation: Feeney, P., Schneider, S., Lymperopoulos, P., Liu, L., Scheutz, M., & Hughes, M. C. (2022). Novelcraft: A dataset for novelty detection and discovery in open worlds. arXiv preprint arXiv:2206.11736.

title: Exploiting variable correlation with masked modeling for anomaly detection in time series.
excerpt: Online anomaly detection in time series is a challenging task, especially when the time-series are stochastic. We propose a novel approach to exploit the correlation between variables in time series data to improve the performance of anomaly detection.
citation: Lymperopoulos, P., Li, Y., & Liu, L. (2022). Exploiting variable correlation with masked modeling for anomaly detection in time series.
